title: Director, Consumer Business Intelligence – Self Care NA
description:
Description  

Kenvue is currently recruiting for:

  




**Director, Consumer Business Intelligence – Self Care NA**

  




This position reports to Senior Director, CBI – NA Brand Growth, and is based in Skillman, NJ.

  




**Who we are**



At Kenvue, we realize the extraordinary power of everyday care. Built on over a century of heritage and rooted in science, we’re the house of iconic brands - including NEUTROGENA®, AVEENO®, TYLENOL®, LISTERINE®, JOHNSON’S® and BAND-AID® that you already know and love. Science is our passion; care is our talent. Our global team is made by 22,000 diverse and brilliant people, passionate about insights, innovation and committed to deliver the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means to have the power to impact life of millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage – and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future–and yours.  


**Role reports to:** Senior Director, CBI – NA Brand Growth

  


**Location:** Kenvue’s corporate headquarters is scheduled to move to Summit, NJ in or around early 2025 and the role is expected to be based in Summit, NJ.

  


**T****ravel %:**5-15 (regular meeting attendance in Fort Washington, PA is required until early 2025)

  


**Pay:** Annual base salary for new hires in this position ranges from **$144,000** to **$247,250.** This takes into account a number of factors including work location, the candidate’s skills, experience, education level & other job-related factors.

  


**What you will do**



This role will serve as the Consumer & Business Intelligence lead for Self Care NA team. Through deep consumer understanding, application of advanced analytics tools, external market knowledge, and implementation of Kenvue Science of Brand Growth principles, you will be part of a high-performance team and serve as a strategic partner to NA Self Care Brand Growth team. They will be looked upon to:


* Identify challenges and opportunities, shape the appropriate business questions to address and design the most effective ways to answer.
* Translate learnings into recommendations and tell a story that drives sustainable business growth and stronger outcomes.
* Mentor and coach a team of individuals that support Self Care squads


This role covers quantitative and qualitative research as well as analyzing in market data (i.e. NIQ Retail Panel) and application of analytics tools such as MMM and price & promo analytics to support strategic plans and brand growth.



Key Responsibilities



This individual plays a key role in influencing the vision, strategy and activation choices for Self Care segment in NA.


* Fosters ‘strategic thought partner” – empowering vendors to act as extension of CBI team (including, training and proactively bringing new knowledge and ideas to the team); Supervises vendor partners to execute projects; Anticipates and quickly develops contingency plans for complex project issues; Proactively manages priorities across businesses.
* Ability to develop, shape and deliver research audits and integrated learning plans to identify knowledge gaps and address key business issues.
* Leads the translation of consumer foundational work, broad, cross-customer shopper insights and category knowledge into insights to identify and address consumer & customer opportunities.
* Uses knowledge of key macro trends and leads understanding of consumer, market and competitive landscape to diagnose business performance and address focused business issues; applies understanding of brand/marketing fundamentals in marketing plan and category/brand strategies development.
* Leads syndicated and panel analyses with the ability to translate learning into concrete recommendation for business growth, including the integration of the multiple data sources into complete, coherent analysis.
* Maximizes analytics to understand business drivers and predict business growth. Working in concert with CBI analytics to ensure all deliverables are grounded in business capabilities/realities and expected to lead the implementation of learnings into actions.
* Integrate knowledge from multiple sources and creates meaningful interpretations and recommendations that address business issues; Interpret and pragmatically translate research learning into feasible business building action steps, and ensure alignment with key business partners (including brand growth, customer strategy, capability and customer teams)
* Uses diverse range of research tools/resources/processes to assess business issues; Independently and proactively identifies the key business issues/questions and develops the most appropriate research design and analytic plan to address business/ research needs. Acts as an authority in research and questionnaire design and interpretation.
* Supervises, mentors and coaches CBI team who are embedded in squads
* Acts as a business partner, not just a market research specialist. Manages complex business issues and helps team set strategic direction. Creates consensus.

Qualifications **What we are looking for**

* A minimum of 5 years of Sr Manager/Associate Director or minimum 2 years of Director level experience is required
* A minimum of 12 years overall consumer and shopper insights experience is required
* Self Care/OTC Experience is highly preferred
* Breadth of experience with consumer research, including methods, techniques, agency partners, and business applications. Must have comfort & aptitude to apply these skills to various situations and guide others on how to interpret/drive action against results under supervision.
* Strong familiarity w/ Digital Analytics, Data Science, & Advanced analysis techniques, and ability to apply in the business.
* Ability to connect the dots, tell a compelling store and create bias for action
* Ability to think analytically to understand complex or ambiguous problems or issues and communicate solutions/conclusions clearly and concisely
* Actively builds trusting relationships with internal and external stakeholders to understand their needs and expectations, align on timelines and deliverables, collaborate on shared objectives, and ensure impactful progress towards goals.
* Demonstrates ability to influence cross-functional and upper management to impact decision-making; Willingness to “have an opinion” backed up by insight and analytics and the confidence to influence key stakeholders in meetings and one to one basis

  


**What’s in it for you**


* Annual base salary for new hires in this position ranges from **$144,000** to **$247,250****.** This takes into account a number of factors including work location, the candidate’s skills, experience, education level & other job-related factors.
* Competitive Total Rewards Package\\*
* Paid Company Holidays, Paid Vacation, Volunteer Time, Flexible Ways of Working & More!
* Learning & Development Opportunities
* Employee Resource Groups

  


* Note: Total Rewards at Kenvue include salary, bonus (if applicable) and benefits. Your Talent Access Partner will be able to share more about our total rewards offerings and the specific salary range for the relevant location(s) during the recruitment & hiring process.

  



Kenvue is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.



#LI-AO1

  


Primary Location NA-US-New Jersey-Skillman
Relocation Eligible No
Travel Yes, 10 % of the Time

title: Turkish-Speaking Legal Assistant
description:
**About Us**

Meirowitz & Wasserberg, LLP, is a mid-size trial law firm that is dedicated to fighting for injured people with offices located in NY, NJ, PA, NC, FL, IL and TX. We represent people, not corporations. Join our team to help injured folks get the justice they deserve.

**About the Role**

We are currently seeking a Turkish-speaking Legal Assistant to join our Manhattan, NY office to provide clerical and administrative support to our team there. This position will be 5x per week in our Midtown Manhattan office.

**You Will:**

* Perform general administrative tasks such as data entry, scanning documents, mailing documents, and filing.
* Answer phone calls and handle inquiries from clients in Turkish and English.
* Maintain calendars and schedules for your assigned attorneys.
* Prepare various correspondence including letters to clients, letters to defendants/trusts, etc.

**You Have:**

* 1+ year of experience using document management systems.
* 1+ year experience in an administrative support role.
* Fluency in Turkish, both written and spoken, is essential for effective communication with our Turkish-speaking clients.

Fluent in English.

**Our Benefits:** 

* Comprehensive Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Plans
* Paid Time Off
* Commuter Transit Program
* Retirement Plan

The quoted salary range represents our good faith estimate as to what our ideal candidates are likely to expect, and we tailor our offers within the range based on the selected candidate's experience, industry knowledge, location, technical and communication skills, and other factors that may prove relevant during the interview process.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $19.00 - $22.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Application Question(s):

* Can you fluently speak, read, and write in Turkish?

Work Location: In person

title: Retail Key Holder
description:
**COME JOIN THE PARTY**

At Party City, we create joy for our customers by making it easy to create unforgettable memories. We are Customer Obsessed. Our **Key Holders**lead by example and possess the energy and enthusiasm to match our customers’ excitement while providing an exceptional shopping experience. We are knowledgeable about our products and services because we have the broadest and best selection of party goods in the industry. We ensure we are in-stock and easy to shop. We inspire our customers with exciting concepts, themes, ideas and provide everything they need to bring their party to life. At PCHI, our promise is Customer First, People Matter, It Can Be Done and Celebrate! We live our brand every day and love to party!

**ARE YOU CUSTOMER OBSESSED?**

At Party City we celebrate each season, holiday, and event with our customers. Our **Key Holders** are responsible for fostering a fun environment and customer obsessed culture. If you have a celebratory spirit, then we need you.

We show *empathy* and create a connection with every customer by offering a friendly greeting and welcoming smile. “Welcome to the Party!!!”

We *listen* to each customer and ask relevant questions to determine the appropriate solution for their event.

We *resolve* simple and complex customer issues daily.

Party City loves *balloons*! We use our personalized creativity to design balloon décor and bouquets for every holiday and occasion.

We celebrate *birthdays* every day.

Our entire team creates *joy* for our customers by providing quality products and services. We bring the customers party vision to life!

**WHAT DO YOU BRING TO THE PARTY?**

If you can answer **YES**to the questions below then this is the job for you!

Do you possess prior retail experience?

Can you lead others in a fast-paced environment?

Are you helpful, passionate, and fun?

Can you inspire and serve others?

Are you adaptable and able to manage change?

Are you results driven?

Are you dependable and committed?

Do you enjoy planning parties and events?

**RESULTS MATTER**

Key Holders ensure our store is always customer ready, and are responsible for the following:

Open/Close the store (alarm activation/deactivation)

Count and prepare tills for store opening.

Count and balance tills at end of day.

Prepare deposit, count safe.

Perform customer service interventions at registers, including price overrides, discounts, refunds, exchanges, and other manual adjustments as needed.

Perform Leader on Duty (LOD) function only when Store Team Leader or Team Leader is absent.

Review and validate that Daily Party Plan tasks are completed as assigned when performing LOD functions.

Solve customer related issues when performing LOD role.

Execute any Emergency Response procedures as needed when acting in the LOD function.

Receiving Freight and filling out daily log – Maintaining receiving procedure.

Balloon orders prepped for next day.

Recovery and cleaning of store (Sales floor/counter/Backroom/breakroom/Bathroom and office).

Daily scan audit (opening)

Communication review on Party Central, reading and reacting to emails and text threads.

Frequent kneeling, bending, and stooping.

Standing for long periods throughout schedule day

**PARTY PERKS AND REWARDS**

We value our associate’s loyalty and commitment to the organization. Full-time team members enjoy:

Comprehensive Benefit Plan

401(K) Program

Tuition Reimbursement

Competitive hourly wage

Fun working environment

Flexible scheduling

Relaxed dress code

30% discount

Work Life balance, no late nights, and closed Thanksgiving, Christmas and Easter

Lifestyle benefits

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: From $15.75 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule

Work Location: In person
company_description: At Party City, we’re committed to helping you create unforgettable memories with your family and friends, and to inspire fun, fresh, and exciting ways to make any moment even more joyful.

title: Resident Care Assistant: HHA/PCA – FT
description:
**Certified Home Health Aide**

Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else’s life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You’ll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You’ll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal “hospitality with a higher purpose.” We know you’ll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*

***Schedule : 3pm-11pm - Tuesday - Saturday***

We are seeking compassionate and dedicated **Resident Care Assistants/Home Health Aides** with a skillset and a heart for helping residents make the most of each day. In this position, you’ll be a friendly and familiar face to our residents, providing hands-on care in a respectful and dignified manner. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The loving care you bring to the services you provide is fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.

**Certified Home Health Aide**

Additional responsibilities include:

* Assisting residents manage Activities of Daily Living (ADLs)
* Escorting residents to meals and recreational activities
* Supporting residents in achieving their highest level of physical, emotional and psycho-social well-being
* Helping out as needed in the Wellness area to ensure the safety, comfort and wellbeing of our residents
* Following all policies and procedures, and adhering to the instructions of the Nurse Shift Supervisor and the Director of Wellness

**Certified Home Health Aide**

**Qualifications:**

* NY-Certified Nursing Assistant, Personal Care Attendant or Home Health Aide
* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Must be able to speak and read in English
* Previous experience with geriatric population preferred, providing assistance with ADLs
* Ability to follow instructions and establish personal care routines
* Basic understanding of dementia; patience and professionalism in redirecting residents
* Ability to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in touch and demeanor
* Maintain an abiding respect for the elderly and remain calm at all times

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Per diem

Pay: Up to $18.55 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Geriatrics

Ability to Relocate:

* Bethpage, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: 2025 Associate Brand Manager- MBA Graduates – University (Multiple Openings)
description:
Description  

Kenvue is currently recruiting for:


**2025 Associate Brand Manager- MBA Graduates – University (Multiple Openings)**

**In this position, you will act as a business leader to drive growth on your brand through strategies & executions that have national impact. The anticipated start date for this position is July 2025.**


**Who We Are**



At Kenvue, we realize the extraordinary power of everyday care. Built on over a century of heritage and rooted in science, we’re the house of iconic brands - including Neutrogena, Aveeno, Tylenol, Listerine, Johnson’s and BAND-AID® Brand Adhesive Bandages that you already know and love. Science is our passion; care is our talent. Our global team is made up of ~ 22,000 diverse and brilliant people, passionate about insights, innovation and committed to delivering the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means having the power to impact the life of millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage – and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future–and yours.

  


**Role reports to:** Brand Team/Marketing Capabilities Team


**Location(s):** Corporate Headquarters - Kenvue’s corporate headquarters is currently located in Skillman NJ, but is scheduled to move to Summit, NJ in or around early 2025


**Pay:** Anticipated base pay for this position is $130,000 and will be based on candidate’s discipline and degree/experience

  


**What You Will Do**


Do you have a passion for marketing and want to work on mega brands that consumers rely on and trust? Do you want a career working for a best-in-class CPG organization with iconic brands and a focus on Health and Wellness? If so, kicking off your career as an Associate Marketing Manager at Kenvue might be a flawless fit for you.



Kenvue develops and markets beloved brands that address the needs of consumers and health care professionals worldwide. Our portfolio ranges across three distinct business units:


* Essential Health brands include BAND-AID® Brand, LISTERINE®, and JOHNSON’S® Baby
* Skin Health brands include NEUTROGENA®, AVEENO®, CLEAN & CLEAR®, and LUBRIDERM®
* Self Care brands include TYLENOL®, MOTRIN®, ZYRTEC®, BENADRYL®, and SUDAFED®


You will become an integral part of a brand or marketing capabilities team where you will build core marketing competencies and take ownership of areas like advertising, consumer promotion, market research, analytics, product/package improvements, digital capabilities and more.



Responsibilities May Include:


* Crafting marketing communications (eg. Digital, eCommerce and social content, video, print, sampling, professional, etc.), claims and impactful media connection plans with external agency partners
* Uncovering insights about the category, competitor & retail customers that drive business recommendations
* Successfully setting & ensuring delivery of monthly and annual shipment and consumption analysis
* Conducting consumer research to uncover insights that shape in-market activations
* Collaborating with internal departments including Customer Strategy, Sales, Finance, Regulatory, Supply Chain and Demand Planning to coordinate team activities/projects and attain short-long term sales and profit commitments
* Owning your brand’s P&L & making investment recommendations to drive profitable growth

Qualifications **What We Are Looking For**


Required Qualifications


* Current Graduate student completing their MBA OR Master’s Degree with anticipated graduation date between December 2024- July 2025
* 2+ years business experience


Desired Qualifications


* Degree concentration in Brand Management or Marketing
* 3-6 months of previous Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) internship experience
* You should possess excellent creative instincts and strong leadership skills
* Excellent written and oral communication skills, with an ability to bring out the best in others
* Strategy and data are the core of everything we do, so strong critical thinking and analytical skills
* Digital marketing experience
* Budget management and forecasting experience

  


**What’s In It For You**


* Competitive Benefit Package


* Learning & Development Opportunities


* Employee Resource Groups


* Career Mentors

  




* Note: Total Rewards at Kenvue include salary, bonus (if applicable) and benefits. Your Talent Access Partner will be able to share more about our total rewards offerings and the specific salary range for the relevant location(s) during the recruitment & hiring process.



Kenvue is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

  


Primary Location NA-US-New Jersey-Skillman
Job Function Marketing

**Who We Are**



At Kenvue, we realize the extraordinary power of everyday care. Built on over a century of heritage and rooted in science, we’re the house of iconic brands - including Neutrogena, Aveeno, Tylenol, Listerine, Johnson’s and BAND-AID® Brand Adhesive Bandages that you already know and love. Science is our passion; care is our talent. Our global team is made up of ~ 22,000 diverse and brilliant people, passionate about insights, innovation and committed to delivering the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means having the power to impact the life of millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage – and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future–and yours.

**Pay:** Anticipated hourly pay for this position $20.00 - $27.50 and will be based on candidate’s program year, discipline and degree/experience  


**What You Will Do**



The Finance Co-Op is responsible for:


**Key Responsibilities**


* The Co-op Program is a six-month program focused on providing college students with practical business experience. It allows students to develop leadership, technical and communication skills as well as broaden their understanding of the concepts learned in the classroom by implementing them with Kenvue finance teams
* Specific responsibilities may include budget support, capital budgeting, financial consolidation, month/year end closing procedures, sales reporting and analysis, account reconciliation, and inter-company accounting
* Other common tasks include data analysis, project management support, problem solving, active business partnering and developing innovative methods to improve job metrics and processes

Qualifications **What We Are Looking For**



Required Qualifications


* Candidate must be actively be enrolled pursuing either a Bachelors or Master’s degree and be at least a sophomore
* Candidate must be able to work full time (40 hours per week) during the duration of the co-op position


Desired Qualifications


* A minimum GPA of 3.0 Cumulative is strongly preferred
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (experience with V-Lookups, Pivot tables, etc…)
* Collaboration and team building skills; proven leadership ability
* Analytical mindset and data analysis skills
* Ability to manage multiple projects and initiatives while maintaining a strong sense of urgency
* Must be a self-starter with ability to work independently within a matrix environment where tight timelines exist
* Willingness to investigate, solve, and leverage data to develop recommendations.
* Ability to identify and implement process improvements.
* Dependable and reliable


**What’s In It For You**


* Learning & Development Opportunities
* Employee Resource Groups
* Gain insight into what it’s really like to be an employee at a large CPG organization with valuable networking opportunities with full time employees and fellow Co-ops
* A deep understanding of Kenvue culture and career possibilities
* Tools to deliver meaningful projects and improve upon both your technical and soft skills


Kenvue is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. title: Associate Brand Mgr, Self Care
description:
Description **Associate Brand Manager, Self Care**


**Who we are**



At Kenvue, we realize the extraordinary power of everyday care. Built on over a century of heritage and rooted in science, we’re the house of iconic brands - including Neutrogena, Aveeno, Tylenol, Listerine, Johnson’s and BAND-AID® Brand Adhesive Bandages that you already know and love. Science is our passion; care is our talent. Our global team is made up of ~ 22,000 diverse and brilliant people, passionate about insights, innovation and committed to delivering the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means having the power to impact the life of millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage – and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future–and yours.



Role reports to: Senior Brand Manager, Self Care
Location: Skillman, NJ (Kenvue’s corporate headquarters is currently located in Skillman NJ, but is scheduled to move to Summit, NJ in or around early 2025.)
Travel : 10%
Pay: 88,000- 142,600
**What will you do**



This Associate Brand Manager will manage the day-to-day brand strategy and portfolio management to help drive growth for the US, with a primary focus an OTC Brand/products. Specifically, the Associate Brand Manager, will:


* Monitor competitive market dynamics to inform development of, &/or changes required to, marketing plans. Partner with Market Insights & Research, category/sales analytics partners to develop learning plans and assessment of marketing plans (define KPI's, assess against goals, implement optimizations)


* Maintain comprehensive knowledge and understanding of current environment and industry trends, oversee category and competitive analysis, stay abreast of latest competitive activities and sales


* Support the brand strategy, planning, and execution of brand/product plans with a digital first approach to help driving short and long-term sustainable growth, while building strong brand equities.


* Understands and advocates for consumer needs and preferences. Proactively looks for opportunities to expand brand passion and improve consumers experiences with the Brand to deliver brand growth goals.
* Create holistic digital first plans for brand communications to develop and distribute content successfully during moments that matter across multiple channels, including linking to omni-channel shopper & retail activation.
* Partner with growth and performance team to optimize media performance & ROI and manage owned and earned channels to engage with consumers where and when they want to connect with our brands.


* Partner with Customer Strategy teams to develop omi-channel retail strategy and plans tied to brand strategy and business objectives.


* Manage brand budget and analytics to help deliver brand P&L goals.
* Have close partnership with innovation teams to influence innovation pipeline with consumer insights and marketplace knowledge.


* Maintain quality and compliance through timely training, strict compliance with procedures, exercising the highest integrity, embracing employee involvement and commitment to doing the right job the first time

Qualifications **What we are looking for**


**Required Qualifications**


* A BA/BS degree is required; a Master’s in business or marketing specialization preferred
* A minimum of 2 years of commercial marketing experience - marketing, sales or related experience is required

  


**Desired Qualifications**


* Ability to work well in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple priorities successfully.


* Ability to work closely with cross functional and other internal teams.


* Comfortable working with numbers, metrics & spreadsheets.


* Works well independently while possessing strong leadership & communication skills and a demonstrated history of building collaborative, lasting relationships that deliver business results.


* High level of energy, drive, enthusiasm, and commitment with a strong bias for action and prioritization.


* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, as well as demonstrated ability to work confidently and respectfully at all levels of an organization, both internally and externally.


* Someone who is highly creative with the ability to think out of the box.


* Able to influence key partners with ideas that build value.

  


**What’s in it for you**


* Annual base salary for new hires in this position ranges from $88k to $124k. This takes into account a number of factors including work location, the candidate’s skills, experience, education level & other job-related factors.


* Competitive Total Rewards Package\\*


* Paid Company Holidays, Paid Vacation, Volunteer Time & More!


* Learning & Development Opportunities


* Employee Resource Groups


* This list could vary based on location/region

  


* Note: Total Rewards at Kenvue include salary, bonus (if applicable) and benefits. Your Talent Access Partner will be able to share more about our total rewards offerings and the specific salary range for the relevant location(s) during the recruitment & hiring process.

title: Care Manager Bilingual (Russian)
description:
Vitability Health is leading the change in how providers deliver remote care. Our next-generation Remote Patient Monitoring (RPM) program enables medical teams to provide safe, effective remote care that improves patient outcomes, lowers patients medical expenses, empowers patients to be fearless, and live longer lives. We are a team of dedicated, mission-driven pros who seek to work with colleagues who inspire us and share our mission and core values.  

Qualifications


* Medical Assisstant (MA)/LPN or LVN/RN/CNA with unrestricted license in New York
* Desire and ability to work in an environment within a fast paced culture
* Self-motivation and the ability to work independently with minimal direction
* Must be Bilingual (Russian)
* Experience with Medicare patients
* Experience performing virtual visits with patients and telephonic care management
* Interest in professional leadership growth and development opportunities with a growing organization
* Technically savvy.
* Interest in operating in a new, exciting clinical program and become an integral player in the development of processes and best practices in caring for RPM patients
* Strong verbal and written communication skills

  



Responsibilities


* As a care manager, you love building relationships with patients based on trust, utilizing motivational communication techniques and strategies, to help drive positive health behavior change and improved patient outcomes
* This is accomplished through collaborative planning sessions with patients to outline patient-centric goals and the development of associated action plans to improve their health and well-being
* Remote work opportunity, this role provides the chance to serve patients by proactively monitoring, educating, and coaching patients on a plan for better health
* The care manager plays a vital role in educating patients on how to manage their acute or chronic medical conditions, with a goal to maintain health, wellness, and to avoid emergency room utilization and hospitalization
* Encounters with patients will be performed via a desktop app/mobile app that allows for remote monitoring of physiological markers like blood pressure/weight and audio-visual telehealth visits
* Significantly impact longitudinal patient engagement in RPM program(s)
* Provide preventive health and disease management education and coaching
* Schedule and perform regular audio-visual visits with assigned patients
* Document visit findings in software platform, including goals and actions
* Lead collaborative care planning sessions with the patients to define health goals
* Manage patient messaging and alerts
* Direct patients to treating physician for routine questions

title: Project Manager, Client Onboarding
description:
Enfusion is a pioneer in developing innovative, native cloud investment management software, analytics, and managed services for asset managers and hedge funds around the globe. We underpin the investment operations of fund managers from our global offices spanning four continents. Our unique, seamless, SaaS-based platform is reshaping the global investment operations landscape by removing traditional information boundaries and uniting the front-, middle- and back-office into one system, with one unified data set.

Passionate about client service, we complement our software solutions with expert middle- and back-office managed services. In fact, we've been recognized as *Best Managed Services Provider* at the HFM EU Services Awards. We help fund managers around the world streamline their operations, mitigate risk, and improve transparency and reporting so they can confidently focus on what they do best – invest.  

  

As a company, we're absolutely committed to the growth, development, and well-being of our people. Enfusion is where you can pursue your passion, showcase and further develop your skills, and launch a meaningful and rewarding career. If you're looking for a culture that is inclusive, collaborative, entrepreneurial, values diversity, fosters and rewards creative exploration, and strives to continually exceed client expectations then we're looking forward to hearing from you.

Learn more about Enfusion by visiting www.enfusion.com and apply today!
The Team:



Project Managers sit within the Client Onboarding team and help ensure a smooth and efficient onboarding process for new clients. Supporting the three verticals (PMS, OEMS, and Managed Services Implementation), the Project Management Office oversees and manages various projects and ensures that timelines and goals are met, while monitoring budgets and mitigating risk.

  



The Role:



The Project Manager will partner with internal teams to implement projects for clients; including traders, portfolio managers and operational users throughout the project lifecycle and serve as the central point of contact for Enfusion teams including Solutioning, and Delivery. This role will build strong product knowledge, manage a positive relationship with our clients, understand and apply project methodologies and risk management processes, and act as a point person for client-facing communication.

  



What You'll Do:


* Determine project scope and objectives to ensure teams are able to deliver against commitments
* Identify resources to deliver projects and forecast and resolve capacity utilization problems
* Create and manage project plans, course correcting and escalating where necessary
* Publish high quality project transparency to senior stakeholders on a regular basis
* Utilize industry best practices, techniques, and standards throughout the project lifecycle
* Engage senior client and internal stakeholders to review project progress and task-level status.
* Liaise with the internal teams to support problem resolution activities
* Identify opportunities for project management process improvements

  



What You'll Need:


* Bachelor's degree required - computer science, finance, economics, or a related field preferred
* 4+ years of project management and related experience
* Project Management Professional (PMP) certification preferred
* Strong familiarity with project management software tools
* Methodical problem solving abilities
* Strong interpersonal skills
* 2 years of Fintech onboarding and / or software implementation experience preferred
* A client-service mentality and collaborative work style.
* Ability to manage competing priorities and deliver with high quality

  



**The salary for this position is $100,000 - $110,000 + bonus + benefits.**


* **Note: This good faith pay range is provided in compliance with NYC law and the laws of other jurisdictions that may require a salary range in job postings.**

  



#LI-ST1



Enfusion offers a competitive compensation and benefits package, retirement and pension plans, and generous Paid Time Off policy; and paid parental leave. Other perks include commuter benefits, and an employee assistance program. All benefits and programs are subject to applicable eligibility requirements.

Enfusion is fully committed to providing equal employment opportunity to job applicants and employees in recruitment, hiring, employment, compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, training, and all other terms and conditions of employment. Enfusion will not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, religion, veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, creed, citizenship or any other status protected by laws or regulations in the locations where we do business. We endeavor to maintain a drug-free workplace.

Position will remain open until filled.

title: Landscape Technician (Stormwater)
description:
**Hiring Immediately!**  

  

**Location:** Freehold, NJ 07728  

**Schedule:** 40-55 hours per week, Full Time, Monday - Friday only  

**Compensation:** $18.00 - $21.00+ an hour depending on experience  

**Travel is required for this position.** We provide lodging expenses, $55 per diem, and the use of a company vehicle. 4-8 days of travel per month is typical (M-F only).  

  

**Spark Your Potential at Apex Companies!**  

  

Join Apex Companies, a mid-sized Environmental Consulting firm offering diverse opportunities nationwide. Apex stands out for its commitment to environmental impact, industry leadership in stormwater management, and unwavering dedication to employee safety and training. Here, you'll find not just a job, but a pathway for promotion and career growth, supported by our local expertise and stable company culture. If you're driven by shared values of social responsibility, teamwork, and a strong work ethic, Apex welcomes you to be part of our success story.  

  

We're hiring a **Landscape Technician (Stormwater) in Freehold, NJ****(07728****)** to play a key role in providing landscaping and maintenance expertise to service our clients' stormwater infrastructure on commercial properties. This position is a driving force behind our Stormwater team's success. If you have prior experience in Landscaping, as a Lawn Maintenance Technician, Construction Worker, General Laborer, or Groundskeeper, or if you enjoy working outdoors, we want to hear from you!  

  

**Why you’ll love being on the Apex team:**

* Incentives: Performance-based bonuses and incentives.
* Time Off: 15 days of annual paid time off and 9 company holidays
* Safety Benefits: Personal protective equipment provided, water breaks for summer season
* Healthcare: Company-subsidized medical, dental, and vision plans
* Financial Security: Company-paid life insurance, optional short and long-term disability insurance, 401k match, tuition assistance, and continuing education support

**What you’ll do:*** Routine landscape maintenance and light repairs of stormwater systems and infrastructure (retention ponds, detention basins, drainage ditches, stormwater grates, and other stormwater assets)
* Perform mowing, weed-trimming, debris removal, ground maintenance and cleanup, light construction, and maintenance repairs for client properties.
* Operate landscaping and light construction equipment.
* Travel from the shop to client sites locally and regionally using the company truck. 4-8 days per month is typical (Monday - Friday).

**What we're looking for:*** At least 1-2 years of experience with outdoor labor (landscaping, lawn maintenance, underground utilities, construction, grounds maintenance and repair, or similar work).
* Must pass pre-employment screenings. We are a drug-free workplace.
* Valid driver's license, safe driving record, and a reliable method of transportation.
* Willingness to travel.
* Solid understanding of landscaping equipment and materials
* Ability to perform various physical tasks (i.e. bending, kneeling, pushing, pulling, lifting, etc.) and work in a variety of weather conditions.

**Interested?** Visit our website apexcos.com to apply today!

title: Performance Site Lead
description:
Job Summary:
Responsibilities:
We’re seeking a Performance Site Lead to join our team! As our new Performance Site Lead, you will:* Manage daily operation function of the facility or facilities.
* Manage and mentor staff to provide world class experience to our clients
* Instructs, motivates, and assists clients in a safe, legal, moral, ethical manner to achieve their goals.
* Motivates and assists Performance team with daily activities including but not limited to scheduling, coordinating clients, and program design
* Ensure communication and alignment with Regional Performance Manager
* Regular communication with Regional Performance Manager
* Provide feedback from site team members to Regional Performance Manager
* Oversee operational and staffing implementation at the site level
* Oversee direct site level staff responsible for the delivery of solutions
* Responsible to follow EXOS methodologies and EXOS program design
* Assure appropriate scheduling and staffing as per contractual obligations
* Assist the Regional Performance Manager to train and develop site team members to implement programs that demonstrate impact in alignment with company and agreed upon client objectives to assure
* Quality control of methodology
* Program delivery consistency
* Product and solution implementation
* Troubleshooting to resolve operational issues
* Exceptional customer service delivery
* Primary point of contact for site level staff for internal helpdesk issues with product/programs
* Escalate site level internal helpdesk issues with product/programs to Regional Performance Manager
* Conduct performance evaluations for site level staff and maintain performance evaluation documentation with assistance from Regional Performance Manager
* Maintain and foster a positive site level staff community and culture
* Evaluate designated site level operations and performance, as well as performance of site level staff in alignment with both company and client company objectives to ensure optimal outcomes
* Support achievement of site level customer metrics
* Participating in program planning and development, as well as design and/or carry out related research
* Leading and/or participating in staff education covering all aspects of EXOS methodology
* Perform all aspects of position held in a professional manner
* Follow established policies and procedures of the company
* Perform other tasks as assigned


The Ideal Candidate will have:* At least three (3) years of strength coaching/personal training experience
* Earned a BA/BS Kinesiology or Sports Science or related degree (Master’s Degree preferred)
* Hold a current industry certification, preferably NSCA-CSCS or NASM
* Current CPR/AED/First Aid Certifications
* Knowledge of EXOS methodology, products, and solutions
* Excellent presentation skills in both small and large group settings
* Strong customer service skills where servicing the “client” is top priority
* Energy and passion for helping others achieve their personal goals
* The ability to work independently with little daily supervision
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
* Experience teaching group fitness classes with emphasis on helping improve technique and ability
* Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office Suite or related products


Physical Requirements:* Candidates applying for this position should be able to lift up to 50 pounds unassisted repeatedly throughout the workday.
* Frequent walking around and demonstrating and assisting with exercise movements; bending, stretching, lifting, pushing, pulling and squatting are movements performed daily.


Residents of California, Colorado, New York, and Washington: Per pay transparency requirements, the compensation for this position ranges from $23.00/hour to $38.00/hour. Pay is dependent on factors including site location, specialty, certifications and work experience as well as other business needs. Exos offers a comprehensive benefits package for all full time employees (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements), which includes health insurance, life and disability benefits, 401(k) plan, and paid time off. Additionally, Exos offers a variety of part time benefits (subject to eligibility requirements).
WHO WE ARE
For nearly 30 years, Exos has been dedicated to getting people ready for the moments that matter by promoting a holistic approach to health. As an elite coaching company, Exos applies its evidence-based methodology to programming designed to unlock the potential in everyone from corporate employees, to elite athletes, military operators, and beyond.
Simply put, we “get you ready” for the moments that matter — whether that’s striving to excel at work, or training for a major athletic event. How do we do it? Our employer solutions include fitness center management, on-site coaching and classes, and the Exos app, as well as immersive team-building experiences, executive coaching, and personal development programming. Our professional athlete training programs propel elite athletes to new heights in the NFL combine and NBA Draft each year, and our practitioner education courses and workshops provide industry professionals ongoing opportunities for development.
We’ve never been the type to accept the status quo. We’re all about studying, learning, innovating, and making waves. And we feel that it’s our responsibility to help others because we know there’s a better way. That better way is Exos Readiness.
We are an equal opportunity employer
EXOS is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating an inclusive and welcoming workplace for all. We invite applicants from a wide variety of identities, ideas, perspectives and experiences and encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply. Exos offers reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities.

title: Patient Accounts Representative/Biller
description:
**Job Title:** Patient Accounts Representative/Biller  
**Location:** Blythedale Children's Hospital, Westchester County, New York  
**Salary:** $51,500 - $61,500 per year

This salary range is provided in accordance with applicable law. The actual salary for an individual hired for this role depends on a variety of factors, including an individual’s experience and level of education.

**About Us:** Blythedale Children's Hospital is a leading pediatric hospital dedicated to providing comprehensive, compassionate care. As the only free-standing children's specialty hospital in New York State, we admit patients with complex medical conditions to our state-of-the-art 94-bed inpatient facility from academic medical centers across New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and Connecticut. Located just 25 miles north of Manhattan in beautiful Westchester County, we offer an inspiring work environment where healthcare professionals thrive.

**Position Overview:** The Patient Accounts Representative/Biller will work closely with the Director and Assistant Director of Patient Accounts, as well as collaborate with the Patient Accounts team, Medical Records, and Social Work departments. This role is responsible for performing full Revenue Cycle duties, including the preparation and submission of claims, reconciliation of AR accounts, pursuit of claims denials, and resolution of credit balances. The biller will also review aging Trial Balances and work to reduce AR balances.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Prepare and submit insurance claims through various stages of processing.
* Reconcile AR accounts and manage denials and appeals.
* Resolve credit balances and address discrepancies.
* Review and reduce aging Trial Balances to lower AR balances.
* Communicate effectively with patients, insurance companies, and internal departments.
* Manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines efficiently.

**Qualifications:**

* High School Diploma required
* 3-5 years of full-cycle hospital facility billing experience.
* Knowledge of Medicaid FFS, Managed Care Organizations, and Commercial Payer claims processing.
* Experience in completing Medicaid applications.
* Strong time management and communication skills.
* **Preferred:** Bilingual in English/Spanish.

**Perks of Working at Blythedale:**

* **Competitive Salary:** We offer a salary that reflects your skills and experience.
* **Tuition Reimbursement & Continuing Education:** Support for furthering your education and career development.
* **Professional Development Opportunities:** Access to mentorship, leadership training, and career advancement programs.
* **Comprehensive Health Benefits:** Including medical, dental, and vision.
* **Retirement Plans with Employer Matching:** Secure your future with our strong retirement plans.
* **Paid Time Off (PTO):** Generous vacation, holiday, and sick leave policies.
* **Safe Work Environment:** Commitment to nurse safety and well-being.
* **Diversity and Inclusion Initiatives:** A workplace that values and supports all employees.

**Blythedale Children's Hospital is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO).**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $51,500.00 - $61,500.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Director Clinical Operations/Director of Nursing
description:
**I.** **Qualifications**
-------------------------



Registered Nurse from an accredited program currently licensed and in good standing with the New Jersey State Board of Nursing, with one year of administrative or supervisory experience in community health programs. **Must have strong clinical skills with hospice experience.** Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as good community relations. Must have the ability to motivate and work with fellow employees and volunteers. Must be effective in working with different levels of health care providers, and able to express the hospice concept to families, patients, physicians, community, volunteers, staff, and other professionals. This position requires planning, supervision, and administration.


**II.** **RESPONSIBILITIES**
----------------------------



The Director Clinical Operations/Director of Nursing will be responsible for the coordination of the Interdisciplinary Team. The Director Clinical Operations/Director of Nursing acts as a liaison between the IDT and the Executive Director.


**The DCO/DON works in conjunction with the Patient Care Administrator to ensure:**


**A.****Admission, Assignment, Supervision of Staff**



q Monitor to ensure coordination and follow-through is complete for all referrals to the hospice program.



q Assist admission team in coordination and assignment of all newly admitted hospice patients to the appropriate team and/or discipline, i.e., admission nurse, case manager or other RN.



q Work collaboratively with the medical records department to ensure all admission documentation (case sheet, initial assessment, initial plan of care, medication profile, CHHA assignment) is completed within 24-hour period and dispersed among team members.



q Assign a Nurse Case Manager to implement the Plan of Care and oversee the delivery of care to the patient/family!



q Assist the medical records department is monitoring the documentation of all written material related to patient care.



q Act as triage nurse for case managers requiring assistance with symptom management.



q Assist with change in level of care for patients including, locating a facility for placement, ensuring a physician for follow up at the facility, notification of primary care physician and medical director, transport, provision of medications and DME.



q Supervise and evaluate the scheduling of CHHA’s, contract employees, nurse case managers, visiting nurses, continuous care staff, on-call nurses, and medical directors.



q Ensure communication of all patient admissions and changes in Plan of Care is appropriately relayed to each member of the Interdisciplinary Team and Primary Care Physician



q Ensure policies and procedures concerning patient care are followed.



q Ensure and participate in annual evaluation of Nurse Case Managers and CHHA’s and Medical Directors.



q Recruit, hire and train all clinical staff.



q Provide orientation of symptom management and medication utilization to all nurses and physicians.



q Provide and/or assist in ongoing training of clinical staff.



q Participate in the CQI program



q Ensure that the highest ethical standards are practiced throughout the organization.



q Monitor the medication profiles for each patient on service to identify formulary and non-formulary utilization.



q Identify ways to reduce local pharmacy utilization and non-formulary medication utilization.



q Participate with medical directors to ensure appropriate and timely evaluation and treatment of all hospice patients.



q Participate in communication with patients and families with concerns/frustrations related to services and care.



q Provide continuous support to all clinical staff.


**B.****Continuous evaluation of skilled nursing staff and CHHA’s**



q Monitor for and ensure appropriate utilization of “Palliative Pathways” and “Formulary” medications in the care of hospice patients.



q Participates in all IDT meetings in which admissions, certifications, recertifications and medical management of the patients are discussed.



q Coordinate and present or arrange for in-services specific for clinical staff throughout year.


q Meet at least quarterly with skilled nursing staff to discuss job related issues and provide support.



q Meet at least quarterly with CHHA’s to discuss job-related issues and provide support.



q Participate in and/or assist with formal evaluation annually for clinical members of Self Care Managed Team (skilled nurses and CHHA’s)



q Provide annual evaluation for all RNs and LPNs.



q Perform joint visits with case managers and admission nurses at least annually.



q Ensure required supervisory visits are done on a routine basis for all LPN”s and CHHA’s.


**C.****Ensure optimum patient care by:**



q Participating in routine visits and admissions of patients in times of high census or low staff availability



q Participate with the management of admissions and patient care in times of high census or low staff availability.



q Assist in staffing or reassigning visits to other team members when staff member is ill or on vacation.



q Participate with program development, community networking and community/medical staff education to achieve census building.



q Assist with the volunteer and bereavement programs.



q Participate in budgetary decisions related to cost effectiveness, and appropriate decision making by clinical staff, i.e., utilization of pharmaceuticals, DME, and patient care supplies, salary, overtime, etc.



q In the absence of the Administrator, perform administrative duties, as necessary.



q Ensure adequate supervision when utilizing time off.



q Provide input into Policy and Procedure development, i.e., revisions, program development and new markets.


**III.** **ORIENTATION AND TRAINING**
-------------------------------------



Lilycare of New Jersey will provide orientation and training, as necessary, to assist the Patient Care Coordinator in performing the responsibilities listed above. Training’s may be in-house, or outside seminars. Evidence of orientation and training will become part of the personnel file.


**IV.** **On Call**
-------------------



The Director Clinical Operations/Director of Nursing will be on call, as necessary, and will ensure that a trained RN and other patient care staff are available at all times to provide patient care.


**V.** **Accountability**
-------------------------



Reports directly to the Executive Director.

Are you a hard-working professional who is looking to work in a warm environment where employees are appreciated and rewarded for their dedication and hard work? Are you tired of the large corporate dialysis chains, their endless red tape, and where no one understands you? Centers Dialysis Care facilities are managed by local professionals who are at the facility and get what you need! Apply now!


**DUTIES:**


* Collaborate with the interdisciplinary team to assess patient status and implement and monitor the progression of care
* Performs care coordination and patient education
* Administer medications and other treatments, as directed by provider/physician staff
* Monitor patients throughout treatment and document patient's responses to treatment requirements
* Mobilizes resources in complex cases to maximize patients' control and participation over his/her own recovery.
* Integrates assessment and diagnostic information with intuition to foresee potential age-specific healthcare needs. Anticipates patients needs.
* Ensures handoff communication and includes a report in terms of the situations most likely to develop and the problems awaiting patient.
* Displays the ability to see the entire unit and is self-motivated to develop a plan for adjusting staffing patterns as needed.
* Plans and provides unique and individualized comfort measures while utilizing intuitive and innovative approaches which are scientifically sound and are a result of evidence-based practice.
* Participates in performance improvement activities at the unit level.
* Performs any other related duties as required or assigned.


**REQUIREMENTS:**


* Active NY RN License
* CPR Certification
* Clinical nursing experience in a dialysis setting is preferred


**Rate**: $45.00 - $55.00


**LOCATIONS:**



Bronx, NY



DIAL23


**ABOUT US:**



With five centers, located throughout the Tri-State Area, Centers Health Dialysis' facilities have been providing quality care for over 13 years to our dialysis community. Our focus is on providing the ultimate patient care experience in outpatient dialysis facilities located both onsite and offsite of skilled nursing facilities. We are proud to share that we are independently and locally owned with stellar on-site management giving our facilities the individualized touch often missing from other large organizations.



Centers Dialysis Care is a part of Centers Health, a fully integrated post-acute care continuum offering rehabilitation and skilled nursing services in more than 45 locations covering four states. At Centers Health and Centers Health Dialysis, we are well known for our commitment to our employees, offering outstanding ongoing training and development, career advancement opportunities, competitive pay rates, generous compensation packages, and more.

description:

title: Finance Manager
description:
Angi® is transforming the home services industry, creating an environment for homeowners, service professionals and employees to feel right at "home." For most home maintenance needs, our platform makes it easier than ever to find a qualified service professional for indoor and outdoor jobs, home renovations (or anything in between!). We are on a mission to become the home for everything home by helping small businesses thrive and providing solutions to financing and booking home jobs with just a few clicks.



Over the last 25 years we have opened our doors to a network of over 200K service professionals and helped over 150 million homeowners love where they live. We believe home is the most important place on earth and are embarking on a journey to redefine how people care for their homes. Angi is an amazing place to build your dream career, join us—we cannot wait to welcome you home!


**About the team**



Angi is seeking a highly driven Finance Manager to lead financial responsibilities across our expanding business lines. As a key member of our Finance team, you will play an integral role in providing strategic financial advice and maintaining financial discipline for Angi's highest growth revenue streams. You will interface regularly with executive teams, and work cross-functionally across departments, including engineering, product, marketing, sales, operations and CX to provide critical financial support that empowers our business leaders to make sound decisions. This is the perfect role for a hungry, analytical team-player who wants to help grow nascent, but very high potential new businesses from the ground up and sees themselves as a future business leader.


**What you'll do**


* Develop and maintain the Finance team's ability to iterate on complex financial models and analyses for our expansion businesses; enable and contribute to effective decision making regarding the revenue growth strategy, cost structure and capital expenditures in order to shape the strategic direction of the businesses
* Analyze, interpret and present relevant financial data and key business metrics to senior leadership - partner closely with cross-functional stakeholders to impact business decisions
* Build a transparent financial framework that helps P&L owners identify and strategize additional opportunities for investment and growth
* Assist in preparing and coordinating the annual budget and monthly forecasts
* Collaborate with other members of Finance and Accounting to prepare and deliver weekly and monthly management reports to key team members
* Assist in preparation of materials for external parties
* Work on special projects and ad hoc analysis as determined by senior leadership
* Own and drive continuous improvements to Finance's reporting and planning tools that help automate processes and deepen the financial bridge across departments


**Who you are**


* BA/BS in Finance or a related field
* 5-9 years of investment banking, private equity, and/or Corporate FP&A experience
* Proficient in financial analysis, financial modeling and problem-solving
* Ability to analyze financial data and prepare financial reports and projections
* Functional knowledge of financial reporting and accounting
* Detail-oriented, highly organized and resourceful
* The ability to deal effectively with ambiguity and thrive in an unstructured, fast-moving environment
* Team player with exceptional interpersonal skills; ability to build and maintain effective cross-functional relationships
* Prior small company or start-up experience a plus
* Experience with SQL, Looker, Power BI and/or NetSuite a plus


**We value diversity**



We know that the best ideas come from teams where diverse points of view uncover new solutions to hard problems. We welcome and value individuals who bring diverse life experiences, educational backgrounds, cultures, and work experiences.


**Compensation & Benefits**


* The salary band for this position ranges from $100,000-$140,000, commensurate with experience and performance. Compensation may vary based on factors such as cost of living
* This position will be eligible for a competitive year end performance bonus
* Enjoy a hybrid work environment, with 2 days in-office per week
* Full medical, dental, vision package to fit your needs
* Flexible vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need it
* Pet discount plans & retirement plan with company match (401K)
* The rare opportunity to work with sharp, motivated teammates solving some of the most unique challenges and changing the world

title: Engineering Manager
description:
Angi® is transforming the home services industry, creating an environment for homeowners, service professionals and employees to feel right at "home." For most home maintenance needs, our platform makes it easier than ever to find a qualified service professional for indoor and outdoor jobs, home renovations (or anything in between!). Angi is looking for anEngineering Managerwith leadership, delivery, and design experience to lead one of our software development teams as we work together to build something better. At Angi, we form high-impact engineering teams and empower them to iterate rapidly on delivering the best service experience for our customers and service professionals. As an Engineering Manager you will lead & mentor a team of engineers, own large parts of our products and influence technical and product decisions. You will collaborate across the organization with technical and non-technical peers, develop a team that delivers sound technical solutions to challenging problems, champion the team's impact to the business, and continuously grow as an engineer and manager.


**What you'll do:**


* Lead and mentor an innovative team of software development engineers – developing people as you grow our business and technology
* Deliver products that enable service professionals to do the work they love and help homeowners love where they live
* Partner with passionate Product and Design counterparts to deliver impactful products and continuously evaluate the most effective way to deliver short- and long-term solutions
* Help us establish a diverse and inclusive organization based upon safety and contribution, while supporting your peers and the teams they support
* Foster a positive, supportive, and lively work environment while providing opportunity for team members to tackle new roles and take on new responsibilities
* Own the ins and outs of a system that is constantly growing and evolving while ensuring the quality of our products and the business continuity of our systems
* Learn about new ways to build amazing software, systems and people by actively participating in a culture of Collaboration, Innovation, Delivery and Caring
* Grow as a leader and a technologist through coaching and feedback from your leaders and peers while helping us reimagine and improve our culture and practices


**Who you are:**


* 7-20 years of professional experience within architecting, developing, and shipping software products and/or services
* 3+ years of experience building people and teams: embodying servant leadership, empowering teams & collaborative work practices
* Able to thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth environment that respects its engineers and users
* Knowledge of Java, C#, JavaScript, or any other popular production language
* Ability to collaborate with product & business counterparts, and present ideas to internal and external audiences
* Test Driven Development: AAA unit test, BDD requirements, system verification
* Delivery within CI/CD, multiple environments, agile, lean, or Kanban
* Proficiency on microservice architecture: hybrid monolith, isolated services, disparate data sources
* Experience on distributed systems: design, caching, CQRS, message driven & large-scale processing
* Proficiency on cloud-based systems: hybrid on-prem, Lambdas, elastic scaling, resiliency
* Design thinking: designing new systems from scratch and adapting legacy
* Designing patterns: Gang of Four, async, distributed, responsive services
* Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field required


**We value diversity**



We know that the best ideas come from teams where diverse points of view uncover new solutions to hard problems. We welcome and value individuals who bring diverse life experiences, educational backgrounds, cultures, and work experiences.



**Compensation & Benefits:**


* The salary band for this position ranges from $130,000 - $230,000,commensurate with experience and performance. Compensation may vary based on factors such as cost of living.

title: Healthcare Support Specialist
description:
**Healthcare Support Specialist**

**Monday-Friday 9am-5pm**

**Please No Phone Call.**

The Healthcare Support Specialist will be responsible for managing and coordinating services for clients receiving Medication-Assisted Treatment (MAT) at our community medical clinic.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* **Client Services Coordination and Support:** Serve as the primary point of contact for all clients, providing support and guidance throughout their treatment and healthcare journey. Schedule appointments, follow-ups, and coordinate care with medical and behavioral health providers.
* **Program Administration:** Manage program logistics, including tracking client progress, maintaining accurate records, and ensuring compliance with clinic policies and MAT regulations.
* **Outreach and Engagement:** Conduct community outreach to identify and engage potential clients. Collaborate with community partners to promote MAT services and educate the public on substance use disorder treatment options.
* **Multi-tasking and Prioritization:** Manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, including client scheduling, data entry, and coordinating with clinical staff to ensure timely service delivery. Additionally, the ideal candidate will have a strong acumen for computers and data systems, with the ability to multi-task among collaborating software used in the initial and ongoing engagement of clients.
* **Data Management:** Maintain detailed and confidential client records, including intake forms, treatment plans, and follow-up notes. Assist with reporting and program evaluation by collecting and analyzing data.
* **Team Collaboration:** Work closely with medical providers, counselors, and other team members to ensure coordinated and client-centered care. Participate in team meetings and contribute to continuous program improvement efforts.
* **Resource Navigation:** Assist clients in accessing additional resources such as counseling, social services, housing, and employment support.
* **Compliance and Quality Assurance:** Ensure that all client interactions and documentation comply with HIPAA, MAT program guidelines, and other relevant standards.
* Some travel required for outreach and community engagement activities.
* Ability to work some evenings and weekends.
* Be flexible for a wide range of tasks from the routine and predictable to the unique and unexpected.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree preferred in social work, public health, healthcare administration, business administration, or a related field (Minimum AAS degree with equivalent work experience).
* 2+ years of experience in program coordination, preferably in a healthcare, behavioral health, or a community-based setting.
* OSHA-10 or -30 a plus and/or willing to complete a minimum of OSHA-10.
* Knowledge of Medication-Assisted Treatment and substance use disorders is a plus, but not required.
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively, a must.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and electronic health record (EHR) systems, supported by a strong foundation in general computer knowledge and applications.
* Ability to work independently as well as part of a multidisciplinary team.
* Experience with community outreach, client engagement, and relationship-building.
* Commitment to maintaining confidentiality and ethical standards in patient care.

**Please No Phone Calls**

title: VP, Investment Banking
description:
EF Hutton LLC is a fast-paced, high-growth, global investment bank founded by experienced investment professionals that have collectively financed over $250 billion for public and private companies alike. EF Hutton offers strategic advice and financing solutions to middle market and emerging growth companies around the globe.

Learn more about us at *https://efhutton.com/ and* ***to check out and apply for the latest roles available, please check out our Indeed page here:*** **https://www.indeed.com/cmp/Ef-Hutton-1/jobs** 

**POSITION SUMMARY:**

The Vice President role will be responsible for generating and managing new business, instilling trust with clients and ensuring flawless engagement, closing transactions, and acting as a role model and resource for the early career banking team members. The Vice President will be responsible for executing public and private capital raising and advisory transactions, including: IPOs, Follow-ons, PIPEs, private equity and debt placements, and buy-side and sell-side mergers and acquisitions. The Vice President will instill trust with clients and act as a role model and resource for the Investment Banking Associates and Analysts.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Manage deal execution and lead project management throughout the entirety of the transaction
* Play a key role supporting origination, evaluating opportunities and executing deals; will have a broad scope and variety of assignments and products across multiple sectors
* Assist in coordinating information flow and execution with product groups
* Participate in and lead marketing meetings with clients
* Daily interaction with senior team members and client management teams to execute transactions and discuss strategic alternatives
* Oversee and direct detailed valuation analyses, including DCF, trading comparables, and transaction precedents

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES MAY INCLUDE:** 

Directly supervising staff day to day work, as well as scheduling, tracking time and paid time off, approving overtime and payroll documentation, providing performance feedback. Includes working with General Manager and Human Resources on resolving personnel issues and making recommendations for personnel growth, duty or location changes, employee reprimands, and terminations.

**REQUIRED AND PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**

**Minimum Education:** Bachelor’s degree required

**Required Licensure:** Series 63, 79

**Required Experience, Skills, and/or Knowledge:** 

* Minimum 5 plus years of Investment Banking experience
* Experience with executing IPOs, follow on and shelf offerings and PIPEs a plus
* Strong quantitative and analytical skills
* Professional maturity and experience to interact with other senior bankers
* Excellent technology skills with superior Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills
* Demonstrates strategic and creative thinking and distinguished communication skills
* Ability to manage several projects at once and work effectively as an individual and as part of a team
* Strict attention to detail with demonstrated ability to take initiative
* Strong interest and understanding of financial markets, aptitude to learn, and demonstrated history of strong academic performance and professional drive
* Strong public speaking skills and comfortable with leading large group conference calls

**WORKPLACE LOCATION**

* Our team operates out of our beautiful offices on Madison Avenue in New York City. This role requires daily presence in the office as well as at client offices for meetings, events, etc.

**SCHEDULING REQUIREMENTS**

* Requires some flexibility in scheduling, such as the ability to work evenings and weekends to meet client deliverables.

**TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS**

* Requires ability to travel locally by car/public transportation, as well as regular domestic trips involving air travel for multi-night stays.

EF Hutton is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to invite and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging. The Firm does not discriminate in employment because of race, creed, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship status or protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal laws, rules, or regulations. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact careers@efhutton.com.

title: Peer Recovery Specialist - RISE
description:
**Job Summary:**  

You will provide recovery support and peer coaching to clients. Work with clients to support and strengthen their capacity to participate in their personal recovery, link them to appropriate care, and help them achieve their wellness and recovery goals.


**Organizational Overview:**  

CarePlus New Jersey continues to be a leader in mental health and a pioneer in integrated care in Northern New Jersey for more than 45 years. The CarePlus Foundation was created over 25 years ago to support further the programs and clients of CarePlus who strive to achieve mental well-being and overall wellness. CarePlus strives for excellence in mental health, addiction recovery, and community-based services. Our goal is to offer affordable, accessible, and holistic-centered care that empowers individuals to reach their full potential and enhance their quality of life.

  

**What You Will Do:**


* Attend mandated training to delineate peer role functions, competencies, and responsibilities
* In collaboration with the individual, develop a Recovery Plan
* Educate the individuals on how to navigate treatment, social service, and recovery support systems
* Provide recovery support services based on the individual's preference and his/her assessed needs
* Work collaboratively with the case manager to ensure the individual engages in services for up to a year
* Reinforce, guide, and reassure the individual that recovery is possible and is built on multiple strengths, coping abilities, and the resources of each individual.

  

**What We Need to See:**


* Minimum of high school diploma or equivalency, associate's degree or above preferred.
* Must have two (2) years of experience in the guiding principles of recovery that assist individuals in improving their health and wellness
* A valid driver's license and must be insurable by the agency's automobile insurance.
* Travel is required between service areas; use of own vehicle is required.

  

**What We Offer:**


* 401K, no matching needed
* High-plan insurance at a generous cost
* Union benefits
* Life and Disability insurance
* Per diem opportunities
* Excellent supervision and training
* Continuing education, tuition reimbursement, and eligibility for loan forgiveness
* 10% daycare discount
